meanings.definition: Regard or represent as perfect or better than in reality.
meanings.sent1: She idealises her favorite singer, thinking he can do no wrong.
meanings.sent2: He often idealises his childhood memories, remembering only the good times.
meanings.sent3: The little girl idealises her pet goldfish, believing it can understand her.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, he idealises her as a princess, waiting for her knight in shining armor.
meanings.sent5: The artist idealises nature in his paintings, capturing its beauty and serenity.

meanings.definition: To form an ideal or perfect image of.
meanings.sent1: He idealises his dream house, imagining every detail perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She idealises her future career, picturing herself successful and happy.
meanings.sent3: The child idealises his superhero action figure, believing it has real superpowers.
meanings.sent4: The poet idealises love, describing it as a magical and eternal bond.
meanings.sent5: The architect idealises his design, striving to create a masterpiece of modern architecture.
